line_1: Such sudden Force the floating Captive binds,
line_2: Tho' beat by Waves, and urg'd by driving Winds.

line_1: Souls whom the Tye of Friendship binds,
line_2: Seize a large Portion of our Minds,

line_1: While one attraction Mortal, Angel, binds,
line_2: Virtue, which forms the unison of minds:

line_1: Whom Errors darken, or whom Weakness binds;
line_2: Hear this, ye pious but dejected Minds,

line_1: Her brow an ivy garland binds,
line_2: Her tresses wanton with the winds,

line_1: Half dead himself; The wond'ring youth he binds,
line_2: Who now his sire's severe intention finds.

line_1: In all but those whom av'rice binds, —
line_2: Blest deed! that met consenting minds

line_1: Grant the charm'd talisman, the chain, that binds,
line_2: Or guides the changeful pinions of the winds!

line_1: His awful temples, lo! a fillet binds;
line_2: Nor high debates, nor falling stocks he minds,

line_1: The floods in icy fetters binds,
line_2: Smooths the rough surge, and lulls the winds,

line_1: Forbids th' advancement of the soul he binds,
line_2: So love that clings around the noblest minds,

line_1: Round her bold sons the waving pennons binds,
line_2: And walks with angel-step upon the winds.

line_1: BENDISH, 'tis strange the Charm that binds
line_2: Millions of Hands should leave their Minds

line_1: Eternal bloom her snowy temples binds,
line_2: Fearless of burning suns and blasting winds.

line_1: This compact, that for ever binds
line_2: In holy links two kindred minds,

line_1: A wondrous Bag with both her Hands she binds,
line_2: Like that where once Ulysses held the Winds;

line_1: These neither Seasons guide, nor Order binds:
line_2: I mark the various Fury of the Winds:

line_1: HAIL, beauteous pair, whom Friendship binds
line_2: Soft as the temper of your minds,

line_1: The pride of letter'd ignorance that binds
line_2: In chains of error, our accomplish'd minds,
